abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project was
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. Nonetheless,
            some lessons, address issues relevant to the Borrower, to
            the Bank, and, of general concern regarding software
            development, and computerization. As it relates to the
            Borrower, it is suggested that positioning the project
            within broader public sector reforms, could have enhanced
            government commitments for computerization budget, and staff
            resources; and, that the complexity, and scope of the
            project, suggest reforms of the Bureau of Internal Revenue,
            should have included the reform of dependent agencies, to
            become a fully functional, and credible revenue authority.
            Lessons for the Bank, address the disbursement process,
            since several, minor issues hindered fundamental aspects of
            the project, instead, simplified processes, - e.g., avoiding
            multi-currency contracting - should ease implementation. The
            overly simplified implementation plan, for instance, which
            lacked specific performance indicators, was conducive to a
            plan, tailored to the supplier's suggestions. Rather,
            existing methodologies for software development should be
            enhanced. Software development, and computerization in
            general, call for: realistic, and functional specifications
            agreed by both the client, and developer; re-engineering
            processes, to be conducted prior to computerization; and,
            public awareness on tax administrative procedures.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will establish a
            computerized integrated tax administration system to process
            all taxes, by providing the hardware, tax software, related
            data-entry processing equipment, complementary equipment,
            training, initial operational support and technical
            assistance to establish a modern tax collection system for
            the Bureau of Internal Revenue and the Bureau of Customs.
